About Observable Compute Foundation

Observable Compute Foundation is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit research institute providing empirical mapping of technology terminology evolution and legal-technical alignment.

Our Mission

When concepts evolve faster than institutions can standardize them, coordination failures compound. Legal definitions calcify while technical reality shifts. Translation breaks across domains. Nobody systematically maps this gap.

We provide the first observatory tracking where technology terminology actually clusters versus where institutions say it should. Our quarterly reports serve journalists, policymakers, educators, and researchers during rapid technological change.

What We Do

  • Track terminology evolution across research, legal, industry, and public domains
  • Document legal-technical misalignments with real-world impact analysis
  • Map conceptual clustering through co-occurrence analysis
  • Publish quarterly reports with transparent methodology and open data
  • Provide public API for programmatic access to terminology data
  • Serve rural communities through workshops expanding technology access

501(c)(3) Nonprofit Status

Observable Compute Foundation is a South Dakota nonprofit corporation with 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status pending.

  • EIN: Pending
  • Founded: January 2026
  • Location: Rapid City, South Dakota
  • Status: Articles filed, IRS 1023-EZ submitted
